general_advisory: Remove excess water from the field. Fertilisers and pesticides spray can be resumed in the early morning or evening hours. The prevailing weather condition may attract the sucking pests. Therefore, regularly monitor the field for pest and disease infestation. Keep the field weed-free to minimize disease infestation.

advisory: Remove excess water from the field and keep 2-3 cm water level in the paddy field. The cloudy weather and intermittent rainfall may lead to the infestation of BPH, Rice stem borer, Leaf folder, and Gundhi bug. Therefore, regularly visit the field for the inspection of these pests.

Rice stem borer: Spray Neem oil 1500 ppm @ 1.5 -2 ml/lt. In case of severe infestation, apply granular insecticide Chlorantraniliprole 0.4% GR @ 4 kg/acre or Fipronil 0.6% GR @ 4 kg/acre within 20-25 days of transplanting.

Brown Plant Hopper (BPH): BPH infestation may rise in the near future. Keep a watch on the crops. For controlling BPH infestation, set up light traps during the night. In severe cases of infestation, spray Chlorantriniliprole 0.4% G @ 4 kg/acre.
Before storage, make sure to use celphos tablets to avoid store grain pests. After harvesting, incorporate the plants into the soil for decomposition.
Harvest the matured cobs and sell at the nearby market. Regularly monitor the infestation of FAW and aphids in the field.
Fall army worm (FAW): To manage the attack of fall army worm, spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 4 g/10lt of water or 8 g in a drum (15 lt water).
Phomopsis blight: To reduce the Phomopsis blight disease in brinjal, spray Metalaxyl + Mancozeb combination @ 400 g/acre or Zineb 75% WP @ 500 g/acre in 200 litres of water.
Drain out excess water from the field. Alternaria leaf blight can be managed by spraying Carbendazim or Mancozeb @ 2 g/lt.

Harvest the matured fruit and keep them at safe places or sell them at suitable prices. Regularly monitor the field for disease and pest. Yellow vein mosaic virus may spread through whitefly. To manage it, spray Quinalphos 25EC @ 2 lt/ha. Fruit and shoot borer can be controlled by spraying Emamectin benzoate @ 4g/10 lt.
